item.title: Activity & Creativity. Reflection 14, 15 - Handstand
item.description: Reason In the description, I mentioned that I’ve been experimenting with handstands. It’s something I’ve always wanted to learn, and now I’m finally giving it a try. While some consider it risky, I disagree. The worst-case scenario is I might go into the bridge position or perform a reverse somersault. So, no need to worry—I’ll be just fine. On another note, I see this as a way to breathe new life into my YouTube channel, which had been inactive for about half a year.

item.title: Activity. Reflection 12 - Wood Splitting
item.description: The need The description may be misleading because I don’t mind when it’s freezing and, on the contrary, I actually enjoy it. However, I’m an exception so a certain level of temperature must be maintained using the fireplace which, in our case, is powered with wood. Unfortunately, the wood comes in big slices that can’t quite fit and some adjustments need to be made. This is the reason why I was employed in wood splitting - to make the wood smaller.

item.title: Activity. Reflection 11 - Painting Fence
item.description: Ridiculousness Normally, I would report something about stretching, a new exercise, or football. However, painting my fence took me so long and exhausted so much that I barely had strength to do anything else. So I thought to myself “what’s stopping me from reflecting on this? NOTHING” (beside the fact that my brother was the one to whom the task was initially assigned, but he needed some proper motivation it turned out.

item.title: Activity. Reflection 10 - July Activity
item.description: Little darlin’, I feel that ice is slowly melting Little darlin’, it seems like years since it’s been clear The Beatles, “Here Comes The Sun” Hello world! Although I wouldn’t call myself a summer lover, I must admit that summer opens up the door for a considerable number of activities that are less available or less pleasant during the rest of the year. In addition, summer means vacation, which, supposedly, translates to a huge amount of free time (unless you’re an IB student.

item.title: Service/Activity. Reflection 3 - Meeting with my charges
item.description: A glimpse into my work I regularly meet with all my “Bears”1 from the camp - Piotr, Marcin, and Adam. Since there are three of them, I visit each tri-weekly (usually). This is also due to logistic reasons. They live all across Poznań. Commuting unavoidably consumes much of my time and, although I get to know new places (like a cozy café in Wilda district!) which is fine, sadly I can’t pay them visits more often.

item.title: Activity
item.description: Welcome to my activity section! Here, I will introduce everything I do as a physical exercise. This includes: football, workout and stretching. Football Description: My journey with football isn’t so straightforward. I started hating it, but ended up loving it. Now it’s a great way to wind down and make friendships! By the way, my position is a goalkeeper and favourite club is Manchester United. In 2019 our team went to Denmark.
